Incident.Summary: The subject made suicidal statements, was transported to St. Mary's Hospital, an Emergency Petition was completed.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
This Incident was caught captured on Body-Worn-Camera, T-21

SCENE PROCESSING:
The verbal statements made by the victim led troopers to believe that he would cause harm to himself.

PHYSICAL EVIDENCE:
A Petition for Emergency Evaluation was completed and submitted to the hospital. The form is attached to the report.

NARRATIVE:
On December 19th, 2023, at approximately 0757 hours I, Trooper Lema #7659, was on-duty, on patrol, and operating marked patrol vehicle “T-21”, when I responded to 45967 Indian Way Apartment 521, Lexington Park, MD 20650 to assist Cpl. Ditoto with a report of a burglary in progress.
I made contact with the complainant, whom I later identified by his Washington, D.C ID as Readie Virgil Wright, ll (B/M, DOB: 06/11/1971). Wright stated that he allowed Johnson to enter his residence through the front door.

I spoke to Cpl.Ditoto and he informed me, Johnson had made suicidal statements to him. See Cpl.Ditoto's supplement for further information.

Johnson was handcuffed and placed in the front seat of my patrol vehicle without incident. When Johnson was asked if he wanted to harm himself, he stated no but winked right after. He was then asked for clarification and later stated that he wanted someone to run him over.  

Sgt. Murphy #2362 contacted the Maryland Gun Center. The check revealed that Johnson does not own any regulated firearms. Brent Lindner was the point of contact at the Maryland Gun Center.

Johnson was transported to the Medstar St. Mary's Hospital, where he was released into the custody of the hospital for the purpose of an Petition for Emergency Evaluation. The CC-DC-013 was completed and provided to hospital staff. 

All of the above events occurred in St. Mary's County.

Case Closed, non-criminal

This incident was captured on Body-Worn Camera only.

Scene Processing:

    While at the scene I observed no sings of forced entry or anything else indicative of a burglary/home invasion.

Physical Evidence:

    All physical evidence was completed/gathered by Trooper Lema (7659)

Narrative:

    On December 19, 2023, at approximately 0757 hours I responded to 45967 Indian Way Apartment 512, Lexington Park, St. Mary’s County, Maryland 20653, for a reported burglary with the suspect still on scene.

    Upon arrival, I knocked on the door and the homeowner, later identified as Readie Virgil Wright II (B/M DOB: 06/11/1971), yelled out to enter. I identified myself as the police at which time he opened the door. As soon as Wright opened the door he stated, “There he is,” and pointed towards a man standing in the living room with his arms above his heads. This person was later identified as Christopher Paul Johnson (B/M DOB: 07/13/1977). I turned my attention towards Johnson, and he stated, “It's me.” Due to the nature of the complaint, I requested Johnson place his hands behind his back, so I could detain him in handcuffs. Johnson complied and was placed in handcuffs without incident.

    While speaking to Johnson he advised he had been dropped off at the residence by a mutual friend of he and Wright. Johnson said he used to live with Wright in Prince Georges County, Maryland. Johnson informed me when he arrived at the residence he knocked on the door and Wright opened the door, so he entered because it was cold outside. While speaking with Johnson I noticed his behavior was very cyclic and erratic. Johnson made several statements that made no logical since or had any bearing on the questions asked. When Johnson did appropriately answer questions asked of him he repeated the answers several times. I then stepped away from Johnson, so I could speak to Wright. While I was speaking with Wright Deputies from the St. Mary’s County Sherriff’s Office remained with Johnson.
While speaking with Wright I detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath and person. I noticed Wrights eyes were glassy and bloodshot and his speech was slightly slurred. I also noticed what appeared to be an alcoholic beverage sitting on a table near Wright. Wright denied knowing Johnson; however admitted to living at the same residence Johnson advised he used to live at. Wright informed me he heard Johnson knocking on the door, so he opened the door. Wright said when he opened the door Johnson came in. Wright informed me Johnson did not use any force nor did he threaten to use  any force to enter the residence. Wright said he never told Johnson he was not allowed inside the residence. Wright advised once Johnson entered the residence he informed him not to leave until the police arrived and Johnson complied. Wright was informed on the process to obtain a Peace Order and provided with a victim/witness pamphlet; however due to the statements made by both he and Johnson and Johnson mental state it was determined no crime had occurred.

    I then returned to speak to Johnson to determine if there was somewhere else he could go in the area. While speaking to Johnson he continued to make nonsensical statements. At one point Johnson stated, “They're trying to kill me. They're going to shoot me.” Johnson then mumbled, something under his breath that sounded like, shoot me just shoot me. I asked Johnson if he wanted someone to shot him, and he stated, “No.” Johnson then winked at me. I asked Johnson if he had thoughts of harming himself or wished someone else would harm him, and he again stated, “No,” and winked at me. I informed Johnson I was unsure if he was being truthful with his answers as he was following each statement with an exaggerated wink. Johnson informed me that I knew what he meant by the wink. I then asked Johnson if he meant the wink to indicate that he actually does have thoughts of harming himself or wished for someone else to harm him, and he stated, “You know, you already know.”

    Based on Johnson behavior and statements I determined he was at a substantial risk to either cause harm to himself or others and thus a Petition for Emergency Evaluation should be completed on him.
Trooper Lema and I then escorted Johnson to Trooper Lema’s patrol vehicle was he was seated in the front passenger seat. Trooper Lema subsequently transported Johnson to MedStar St. Mary’s Hospital where he completed a Petition for Emergency Evaluation (CC-DC-013). See Trooper Lema’s narrative for further details.

    Once at the hospital Johnson continued to act erratic. Johnson also became passively non-compliant with hospital staff and had to be sedated. Trooper Lema completed all required paperwork. Johnson was released to the care and custody of hospital staff.

    This case is closed non-criminal.

    All events occurred in St. Mary’s County, Maryland.
